actions.message: >Deleted Messages
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
You’ve died and gone to hell which is run by Satan’s dog, Beelzebark, since Satan has gone missing. You’re working at the diner Brimstone Bites, and you have to delve down into the deeper layers of hell to bring up ingredients for Head Chef Beefy Boof to cook. I’m surprised you forgot, but is that good enough?

For more lore, see `!LoreDenizens`, `!LoreMonsters`, `!LoreFlavour`, `!LoreLocation`, or `!LoreClass`
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
>Avalible Commands
`!Lore` A brief overview of the lore.
`!loreDenizens` Information on the various inhabitants of hell.
`!LoreMonsters` Information on the creatures you'll be hunting.
`!LoreFlavour` Informaion on flavour types you'll find around the world.
`!LoreLocation` Information on the various locations.
`!LoreClass` Information on all the various classes.

**>Admin Only**
`!Purge` Deletes the last 50 messages in the channel.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
In hell, there are souls (you), demons, arch demons, Spectre guides, Devils, and angels. There are non sentient spectres, however...you’ll be hunting them.

For more info, see `!LoreDenizens souls`, `!LoreDenizens demons`, `!LoreDenizens arch-demons`, `!LoreDenizens spectre-guides`, `!LoreDenizens angels`, or `!LoreDenizens devils`.
**Due to technical issues, these are case sensitive, and the bot will only recognise lower-case.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: >Invalid Parameters, try `!LoreDenizens Souls`, `!LoreDenizens demons`, `!LoreDenizens arch-demons`, `!LoreDenizens spectre-guides`, `!LoreDenizens angels`, or `!LoreDenizens devils`.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Souls are what happens to life energy after death. You’re one of them, and all living beings become them in hell. They can create soul shells which act as proper bodies, but if both the shell and the soul is destroyed, you die for good.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Satan gifted these souls with part of his power, transforming the dog souls into demons. They’re powerful beings, who can’t be destroyed easily-but for the most part they’re just sentient dogs. Some of them talk, but most just act like...dogs. Don’t be fooled though, they can kick our asses if you aren’t careful. I would know.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Demons, but with even MORE POWER! They’re bipedal, armor clad dogs with scythes that would wreck anyone who steps out of line. They’re also a lot smarter, and have magical abilities. But dont worry-they’re too busy chasing their tails to bother us, haha!
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
Oh, that’s what I am. We’re conglomerations of various energies that deep in from life, and having an actual spectre guide be formed rather than uh...the monsters...is kinda rare. We manage the diners, and I’m in charge of your diner. 
Though, admittedly I am hurt you forgot who I am.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Our customers, and...that’s about all I know about them. They’re kinda...mysterious.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Mysterious beings scattered about hell. They’re super dangerous, and Satan was one of them. We don’t know where any of them are, anymore.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: >It appears you've entered an invalid parameter. Remember that all parameters (such as `demons` or `spectre-guides`) must be in lower case.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
Most of the time, spectres come out as foodlike beasts which we just call monsters, rather uncreatively. What?! I’m just the messenger, blame the dude who made this whole thing. Anyway, there’s 5 types- Protein, Plant, Staple, Spice and Other. You’ll be hunting them to use as ingredients. 

For more info, see `!LoreMonsters protein`, `!LoreMonsters plant`, `!LoreMonsters staple`, `!LoreMonsters spice`, or `!LoreMonsters other`.
**Due to technical issues, these are case sensitive, and the bot will only recognise lower-case.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
>Invalid Parameters.
Try For more info, see `!LoreMonsters protein`, `!LoreMonsters plant`, `!LoreMonsters staple`, `!LoreMonsters spice`, or `!LoreMonsters other`.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Protein includes any kind of monster where it’s flesh is hunted for, and usually have normal muscle tissue to chomp on. They can range from types similar to beef to fish.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Plant includes any kind of monster which are hunted for fruit, or vegetable parts. Most of the time, their actual bodies aren’t desirable to eat due to their partially Plant like nature giving them fibrous meat.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Their bodies are made up of ‘Staple foods’ such as sugar, salt or flour. Highly concentrated, be careful when harvesting. And for the love of god, dont lick them.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: These monsters are usually useless in terms of eating, but special parts like their blood or ground up horns act as potent spices to use in flavours.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Uh...well. It’s pretty self explanatory. They’re monsters that fall outside the groups, like dairy or bread. Too many food types, so we just shoved them all into this, hah!
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
There are 6 main flavours- <:sweet:429485519194554390>Sweet, <:bitter:429504697859309569>Bitter, <:salty:429556346753384448>Salty, <:sour:429495912138801164>Sour, <:spicy:429475302260080640>Spiciness and <:umami:429568987026685952>Umami. Monsters will have a variety of these flavours, and thus will live in different habitats, so pay attention to the flavours of the beasts you hunt. After all, the chef might get mad if you don’t bring the right ingredients.

Use `!loreFlavour sweet` `!loreFlavour bitter` `!loreFlavour salty` `!loreFlavour sour` `!loreFlavour spicy` or `!loreFlavour umami` for more details.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This particular flavour is represented by <:sweet:429485519194554390>. You'll find that most of the creatures with a high affinity for sweetness are in the layer Dulcis.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This particular flavour is represented by <:bitter:429504697859309569>. You'll find that most of the creatures with a high affinity for bitterness are in the layer Acerbus.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This particular flavour is represented by <:salty:429556346753384448>. You'll find that most of the creatures with a high affinity for saltiness are in the layer Salsus.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This particular flavour is represented by <:sour:429495912138801164>. You'll find that most of the creatures with a high affinity for sourness are in the layer Acidus.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This particular flavour is represented by <:spicy:429475302260080640>. You'll find that most of the creatures with a high affinity for spice are in the layer Conditus.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This particular flavour is represented by <:umami:429568987026685952>. You'll find that most of the creatures with a high affinity for umami are in the layer...Umami. Huh. That one wasn’t really inspired.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
Hell has nine different layers, with seven of them being dangerous. The first layer contains all of the souls and diners. The next seven contain the different monsters of Hell, with each layer based around a specific flavor type, such as Dulcis being a harbor for sweet monsters. The final layer contains the Castle of Hell and the head dog Beelzebark, who's going to fire you if you're going to forget this so easily.

See `!Lorelocation brimstone-bites`, `!Lorelocation gruesome-gauntlet`, `!lorelocation Lucifers-abode`, or `!lorelocation hellevator` for more info.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: This is the diner you are working for. The owner, called ‘The Beefy Boof’, or ‘Beef’ for short is basically completely incompetent, the souls working for us have run and the diner's going to fall at any moment. Literally the only thing keeping it together is me-so you better work your ass off, and don't disappoint little ol me! <3
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: The Gruesome Gauntlet is the little nickname we gave the seven deadliest layers. Each one is centralized around a certain flavor,  if it wasn't obvious from the landscape theming everywhere. The deeper you go, the tougher the monsters are going to get, so watch it! I'm not cleaning up your cremated ashes. The ingredients you need to collect for us are down there, so don't you even dare think about skipping out.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Located on the final layer of hell, it’s an imposing castle where our previous master Satan, or current master Beelzebark resides. All the demons live there too, but don’t expect to see the castle anytime soon. You’re just...too squishy.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Do. Do you really need me to explain this, it’s IN THE NAME-ugh, fine. For ease of access, the public used to be able to travel down this giant elevator system called. Well. It’s literally a elevator in hell-though right now, it’s kinda broken and can’t go down. Cause the locations for each entrance is hidden. Right now, it can only go down into Dulcius.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
There are 4 different classes you as a line chef can take. They are Boucher, Rotisseur, Patissier and Entremetler. Each specialise in different roles, and have special abilities corresponding to each, along with specialities for each unique chef. You can’t be more than one type, though! 

See `!Loreclass boucher` `!Loreclass rotisseur` `!Loreclass patissier` `!Loreclass entremetler` or `!Loreclass specialties`
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Specialising in meat and seafood prep, if you’re a Boucher it means you’re probably the main melee attacker, and most likely end as a tank or a dps. In your human ‘game terms’, anyway.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Grillmasters who use flame in their attacks (unless their specialities deem otherwise), they’re equivalent to a mage, and have some really hard hitting spells! Though, the amount of fire they use always ruins my makeup….
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: The queen or king of desserts, Patissier’s have the role of healing their compatriots. They’re not too bad alone either-they’re competent self buffers as well, and act a lot like a battle cleric.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Each chef will generally have up to 2 specialties, wether passive or active. They’re like extra abilities, but they’re not quite as powerful as their main one. Honestly, I can’t see what the fuss is all about.
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message: Vegetables and soups might be their game, but they’re not useless in the slightest. Rogue like in nature, they precisely attack the enemy for weak spots and tweak flavour profiles like a champ.
actions.name: Send Message
